intro: Hypolytrum longifolium subsp. nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan longleaf hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
